definition: to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Both China-UK relationship and China-EU relationship face important opportunities to build on past success for new progress.
sentences.chinese: 中英關係和中歐關係發展面臨繼往開來的重要機遇。

sentences.english: John Wain, Graham Swift and Julian Barnes are all important figures in inheriting and developing that tradition.
sentences.chinese: 巴恩斯都是這一傳統中繼往開來的重要人物。

sentences.english: Red flag, fluttering, and future, the sacred assembly.
sentences.chinese: 鮮紅旗幟，高高飄揚，繼往開來，神聖集結。

sentences.english: Ambassador Liu said, "We now stand at a fresh start in our relations.
sentences.chinese: 劉大使說，當前，中英關係正處在繼往開來的新起點。

sentences.english: This year is pivotal to China-France relations.
sentences.chinese: 今年是中法關係繼往開來的一年。

sentences.english: Bright red flags, flying high, abroad, sacred rally.
sentences.chinese: 鮮紅旗幟，高高飄揚，繼往開來，神聖集結。

sentences.english: This year, China-ASEAN relations continue to forge ahead.
sentences.chinese: 今年，中國同東盟關係繼往開來。

sentences.english: We sincerely welcome and cooperate with old and new customers.
sentences.chinese: 我們竭誠與新老客戶合作，繼往開來。

definition: see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
to struggle arduously
glorious and flourishing (idiom); thriving
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
glorious achievement (idiom)
fortitude
to meet a challenge
prosperous and developing/flourishing
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
to love Hong Kong (usually implying that one also supports the PRC government)
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
economic prosperity
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
a great number of students (idiom)
to expound/to propagate
